intro: Uniyala anceps, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers, which are followed by follicles containing elliptical seeds. Uniyala anceps is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. It is also noted for its latex-like sap, which can be milky and is used in traditional medicine.
